meanings.definition: The skull, especially the part enclosing the brain.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the patient's cranium to check for any injuries.
meanings.sent2: She gently touched her cranium to feel the bump on her head.
meanings.sent3: The detective thought so hard that he felt his cranium might crack open.
meanings.sent4: Her cranium held the secrets of her past, locked away like a treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The cranium is like a protective helmet for the brain, keeping it safe from harm.

meanings.definition: The bony structure of the head, excluding the face and jaw.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist discovered a fossilized cranium of an ancient human ancestor.
meanings.sent2: He wore a helmet to protect his cranium during the bike race.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his cranium was so big, it had its own zip code.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was so strong, it felt like her cranium was made of solid rock.
meanings.sent5: The cranium provides a sturdy framework for the head, supporting various facial features.
